meanings.definition: Change or cause to change in character or composition, typically in a comparatively small but significant way.
meanings.sent1: She decided to alter her hairstyle for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: He likes to alter his routine every now and then.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to alter its meow to sound like a bird.
meanings.sent4: Time can alter our perception of past events.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colors to alter the mood of the painting.

meanings.definition: Make partial or minor changes to (something).
meanings.sent1: Please alter the settings to improve the performance.
meanings.sent2: They had to alter the recipe slightly to suit their taste.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to alter the dress at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The editor will alter the manuscript for clarity.
meanings.sent5: He decided to alter the design of the logo.

meanings.definition: Become different in some particular way, typically through a series of small changes.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will alter into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The weather can alter suddenly in this region.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon can alter its color to blend in.
meanings.sent4: Her mood can alter depending on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The landscape will alter with the changing seasons.
